channel.title: briefUpdatesPoliticsOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesPoliticsOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: OpenAI's future IPO frenzy
item.description: Wall Street is licking its chops at the mere prospect of an OpenAI IPO, which could unleash a financial frenzy with little precedent if and when it ar...

item.title: Maine Gov. Mills, 77, won't release medical records as age become issue in Senate race
item.description: Maine Gov. Janet Mills , 77, won't commit to release her medical records in her 2026 bid for Senate, Axios has learned, as her Democratic primary oppo...

item.title: Behind the Curtain: Anti-AI socialism could be Democrats' future
item.description: Two unfolding forces will shape significantly the short-term future of the Democratic Party , officials tell us: The popularity of socialist candidate...

item.title: Trump muddles nuke-testing message
item.description: President Trump's post announcing the U.S. would resume nuclear testing featured some inaccuracies, and introduced quite a bit of uncertainty. Why it ...

item.title: Trump tells Senate Republicans to use "nuclear option" to end shutdown
item.description: President Trump called for the end of the Senate filibuster on Thursday, urging Republicans in a post on Truth Social to "initiate the 'nuclear option...

item.title: In Trump’s GOP, the once-mighty tea party is hard to find
item.description: Since the movement upended politics 15 years ago, Republicans have sharply changed direction under MAGA — with many tea party veterans along for the r...

item.title: Trump pleaded for more daylight but Congress stalls again on ‘Sunshine’ bill
item.description: Combatants in the daylight-saving fight thought their prospects were bright after Trump waded in. But once again, the fate of their movement is cloudy...

item.title: Senators, advocates demand explanation on asbestos risks from East Wing

item.title: Judge says she’ll likely order Trump administration to send SNAP funds to states
item.description: The move could keep food assistance flowing despite the federal government shutdown.

item.title: Tracking who Trump is appointing to fill key administration roles
item.description: Follow President Trump’s progress filling over 800 positions, among about 1,300 that require Senate confirmation, in this tracker from The Washington ...

item.title: Trump's approval holds steady despite unpopular policies, per new NYT poll
item.description: Trump’s strength with Republicans on the economy could prove to be a boon for the GOP.

item.title: New poll reveals warning signs for Trump with Latino voters
item.description: A survey from the liberal-leaning group Somos Votantes shows Latino voters are souring on the president.

item.title: Trump is selling a strong economy. Voters aren’t buying it.
item.description: Privately, aides concede voters remain uneasy about prices but argue their policies are beginning to turn things around.

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.description: DeepSeek, SoFi and more in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
